intro: Epimedium violaceum var. grandiflorum, commonly known as the Chinese barrenwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the Berberidaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage composed of leathery, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, showy flowers in shades of pink and purple, typically blooming in late spring. It thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to tolerate shade and its long-lasting foliage.
